title-group.article-title: A Posteriori Error Estimation for Variational Problems with Uniformly Convex Functionals

abstract.p: The objective of this paper is to introduce a general scheme for deriving a posteriori error estimates by using duality theory of the calculus of variations. We consider variational problems of the form <tex-math>$^{\inf}_{v\in V}\{F(v) + G(\Lambda v)\},$</tex-math> where F: V →R is a convex lower semicontinuous functional, G: Y →R is a uniformly convex functional, V and Y are reflexive Banach spaces, and A: V → Y is a bounded linear operator. We show that the main classes of a posteriori error estimates known in the literature follow from the duality error estimate obtained and, thus, can be justified via the duality theory.
